FileStoreProxy * mpFileStoreProxy

Detailed Description

File content provider.

Media store table containing an index of all files in the media storage, including non-media files. This should be used by applications that work with non-media file types (text, HTML, PDF, etc) as well as applications that need to work with multiple media file types in a single query.

The following example demonstrates how to use this FileStore class.

 addFile() {
     // Add an file
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     FileStore* FileStore = new FileStore(*context);
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();

     cv->addValue(FileStore::DATA(), filePath);
     cv->addValue(FileStore::TITLE(), fileName);

     fileStore->add(FileStore::FILE_URI(FileStore::INTERNAL), *cv);

     delete context;
     delete fileStore;
     delete cv;
 }

 showEditAndDeleteFile() {
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     FileStore* fileStore = new FileStore(*context);
     StringArray selection(3);
     selection.replaceAt(FileStore::ID(), 0);
     selection.replaceAt(FileStore::DATA(), 1);
     selection.replaceAt(FileStore::DISPLAY_NAME(), 2);

     // Show files
     Cursor* files = fileStore->getN(FileStore::FILE_URI(FileStore::INTERNAL),
         &selection, NULL, NULL, NULL);

     if (files != NULL && files->getCount() > 0) {
         files->moveToFirst();
         do {
             int64_t id = files->getLong(0);
             String data = files->getString(1);
             String displayName = files->getString(2);

             // ...
         } while (files->moveToNext());
     }
     // Close the cursor
     files->close();

     // Edit an file
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();
     cv->addValue(FileStore::TITLE(), newTitle);

     Uri uri1 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(FileStore::FILE_URI(FileStore::INTERNAL), updateId);
     fileStore->set(uri1, *cv, NULL, NULL);

     // Delete an file
     Uri uri2 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(FileStore::FILE_URI(FileStore::INTERNAL), deleteId);
     fileStore->remove(uri2, NULL, NULL);

     delete context;
     delete fileStore;
     delete cv;
 }

See the sample given above. There are four operations about FileStore: add, edit, show and remove.

static base::String gaia::content::FileStore::DATE_ADDED ( ) [static]

The time the file was added to the media provider.

Units are seconds since 1970.

Type: INTEGER (int64_t)

static base::String gaia::content::FileStore::DATE_MODIFIED ( ) [static]

The time the file was last modified.

Units are seconds since 1970. NOTE: This is for internal use by the media scanner. Do not modify this field.

Type: INTEGER (int64_t)

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::FileStore::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

static base::String gaia::content::FileStore::MEDIA_TYPE ( ) [static]

The media type (audio, video, image or playlist) of the file, or 0 for not a media file.

Type: TEXT

The choice is listed as follows: int32_t MEDIA_TYPE_NONE = 0; // Indicating that file is not an audio, image, video or playlist file. int32_t MEDIA_TYPE_IMAGE = 1; // Indicating that file is an image file. int32_t MEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO = 2; // Indicating that file is an audio file. int32_t MEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO = 3; // Indicating that file is an video file. int32_t MEDIA_TYPE_PLAYLIST = 4; // Indicating that file is an playlist file.

static base::String gaia::content::FileStore::MIME_TYPE ( ) [static]

Type: TEXT

int32_t gaia::content::FileStore::remove ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.

)

Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To update all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
